items.sentence: Tom wasn\'t the only one who wasn\'t doing that.
Tom wondered when you bought your tennis racket.
Tom wondered where Mary had spent her childhood.
Tom worked for a construction company in Boston.
Tom works hard, so his parents are proud of him.
The last thing I\'d ever want to do is hurt Tom.
It doesn\'t necessarily mean that you\'re right.
We couldn\'t have done that without Tom\'s help.
Tom and Mary don\'t go to the movies very often.
Perhaps Tom is too old to do this kind of thing.
Please forgive me for not answering your letter.
Schools will be closed today due to the weather.
The Jacksons are visiting us tomorrow afternoon.
The Jacksons had their house painted dark brown.
An old man was resting in the shade of the tree.
Are there any English magazines in this library?
Are you closer to your mother or to your father?
Tom needs to be transferred to another hospital.
Tom often sits in front of his computer all day.
Tom pushed against the door with all his weight.
Tom put a lot of effort into his school project.
Tom put down his coffee and picked up his phone.
Tom reached for the dictionary on the top shelf.
I\'m the one who taught Tom how to ride a horse.
I\'ve got a feeling Tom is still here in Boston.
I\'ve got something here I think you should see.
Tom won\'t be able to do what we want him to do.
Tom won\'t be able to stop Mary from doing that.
I confiscated a gun from a student this morning.
You need to eat something before you go to work.
There\'s nothing more important than friendship.
There\'s something important I need to tell you.
These grapes are so sour that I can\'t eat them.
Tom won\'t let Mary do anything she wants to do.
Tom, I\'m in trouble. I need you to come get me.
I\'ve finally found what I\'ve been looking for.
I\'ve given Tom everything he\'s ever asked for.
I wonder why my name isn\'t on the list anymore.
I wouldn\'t object if you wanted to go with Tom.
Tom doesn\'t always understand what\'s going on.
Tom doesn\'t know anything about Mary\'s family.
Why are you making such a big issue out of this?
I wonder what the weather will be like tomorrow.
Tom didn\'t call Mary like he promised he would.
Tom didn\'t care whether he made a noise or not.
Tom didn\'t even have time to eat a quick lunch.
Tom didn\'t even know how to write his own name.
Tom couldn\'t say for sure when he\'d come back.
Everything is working out just as Tom predicted.
Excuse me, could you say that again more slowly?
